Billiam.Action: Keeps to himself quietly drawing and does not engage with others in class.
Feels nervous and sinks down in his chair when his name is called and others laugh at it.
Draws on paper quietly and is pleased with his work, showing focus and skill in his own activity.
Reacts nervously and sinks down in his chair when his name is called, indicating lack of confidence.
Reflects on his mother’s kindness and support after being bullied, showing appreciation for her efforts to comfort him.
Expresses self-doubt and social insecurity when questioning what others were jealous of about him.
Confronts Terrence about bullying with insight and maturity, trying to understand the bully's feelings.
Shows vulnerability through internal reflection about being bullied and his mother's advice.
Accepts help and kindness from Tim, leading to a sincere friendship.
Acknowledges his mother's good intentions despite her misguided advice.
Reflects thoughtfully on the nature of bullies and the difficulties in dealing with them.
Smiles deviously when mentioning 'some bad ones' to deal with bullies.
Remains unfazed when hit with a sandwich, handles situation calmly.
Agrees with Tim to settle conflict non-violently and thoughtfully by planning a playground confrontation.
Shows camaraderie and trust with Tim, becoming inseparable friends.
Organizes a covert operation with clear roles and communication, uses walky-talkies effectively, confirms radio checks and status updates.
Quietly sneaks into garage and manages to move undetected, coordinating with Tim to execute the mission.
Successfully executes plan resulting in obtaining equipment (ladder, tape, rope) and escapes without being caught or noticed significantly.
Tries telling the teacher about Terrence's bullying, showing effort to solve problems through authority.
Tries ignoring Terrence and pretending not to care, indicating tolerance and attempts to avoid conflict.
Determines to stand up to Terrence by orchestrating a revenge sandwich plan, demonstrating protective loyalty to himself and Tim.
Refers to Tim as friend and involves him in the plan, indicating trust and camaraderie.
Says 'Revenge is messy' showing some awareness of consequences, indicating sincerity in his feelings.
Plots an ambush on Terrence involving humiliation, which may indicate a vengeful or less tolerant streak.
Sets a trap with a giant bucket of sandwiches to ambush Young Terrence.
Admits that he has no plan for what to do after ambushing Terrence.
Calls his mother to rescue him when the situation escalates.
Smiles and pats Young Tim on the back, expressing affection and friendliness.
Wishes Terrence good luck sincerely despite their past.
Shakes Terrence’s hand after initial awkwardness, accepting a gesture of friendship.
Shields face in terror when greeted by Terrence, showing fear or discomfort.
Enjoys friendly conversation and laughs with Terrence at the restaurant.
Openly shares personal information about his car and plans with Terrence.
Shows confusion and does not warn Terrence when his mother reacts hostilely.
Calmly explains his car situation and arranges for his mom to pick him up on time.
Seems confused about Terence’s panicked reaction and does not anticipate potential social complications.
Sits alone in the lunchroom, enduring bullying without retaliation.
Responds unamused and silently to admissions rep's mocking story; does not escalate the situation.
Writes 'Not Applicable' about his childhood, showing emotional detachment and possible defense mechanism.
Pauses and thinks hard before responding to a question about his childhood, showing some reflection and thoughtfulness.
Responds unemotionally and does not engage with the admissions rep's teasing, maintaining composure.
Writes 'Not Applicable' when asked about his childhood, suggesting avoidance or refusal to engage more fully.
Sits alone at lunch as a child and is unable to prevent being bullied by Terence, indicating social or situational incompetence in youth.
Recognizes that his mother's advice about dealing with bullies is ineffective and reflects critically on it.
Takes initiative as a child by using a flashlight to confront his fear of the boogeyman under the bed.
Concludes that there are no good ways to deal with bullies but hints at knowing some bad ways, suggesting some strategic or clever thinking.
Leads a playful, secret mission with Young Tim involving use of walky-talkies and sneaking around the house.
Involves and trusts Young Tim to help with the mission, coordinating closely and sharing communication.
Pulls a prank by dropping a bucket of sandwiches on Terrence, whom he has tortured.
Admits he has no plan beyond the initial prank.
Nods in shock as his mother arrives to protect him, indicating vulnerability.
Calmly narrates a difficult past event to the admission representative, showing self-awareness and articulation.
Responds politely and accepts Terrence’s handshake despite past awkwardness, demonstrating social confidence and maturity.
Shows a brief moment of terror and shields his face upon seeing Terrence, indicating insecurity or discomfort.
